wikipedia_page.main: Martin Gold (born Nigel Wilson, on 15 April 1966) is a British comedian and after-dinner speaker. He began his professional career as a comedy impressionist in the 1980s. In 2008 Martin took part in the annual pantomime, alongside Darren Day at the Forum Theatre, Billingham. The same year Martin was reviewed in The Stage, "an expert and completely in charge of his comedic situation." Gold also had a Sunday evening radio show on Mansfield 103.2 FM  between 2006–2009. Martin has appeared on numerous television programmes.
